body:
Your pip is probably old? Try `pip install -U pip`. There's currently a gap in support for out of index dependencies in pip/setuptools and nothing really works consistently.

> On 27 Aug 2019, at 23:50, Josh Meyer <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> The phonemizer from BootPhon doesn't install from the dev setup.py script:
> 
> josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ virtualenv -p python3.7 venv-dev
> Running virtualenv with interpreter /usr/bin/python3.7
> Using base prefix '/usr'
> /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/virtualenv.py:1086: DeprecationWarning: the imp module is deprecated in favour of importlib; see the module's documentation for alternative uses
>   import imp
> New python executable in /home/josh/git/TTS/venv-dev/bin/python3.7
> Also creating executable in /home/josh/git/TTS/venv-dev/bin/python
> Installing setuptools, pkg_resources, pip, wheel...done.
> josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ source venv-dev/bin/activate
> (venv-dev) josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ python --version
> Python 3.7.4
> (venv-dev) josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ python setup.py develop
> running develop
> -- Building version 0.0.1+47c32ce
> running egg_info
> writing TTS.egg-info/PKG-INFO
> writing dependency_links to TTS.egg-info/dependency_links.txt
> writing requirements to TTS.egg-info/requires.txt
> writing top-level names to TTS.egg-info/top_level.txt
> package init file './__init__.py' not found (or not a regular file)
> reading manifest file 'TTS.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
> writing manifest file 'TTS.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
> running build_ext
> Creating /home/josh/git/TTS/venv-dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/TTS.egg-link (link to .)
> Adding TTS 0.0.1+47c32ce to easy-install.pth file
> 
> Installed /home/josh/git/TTS
> Processing dependencies for TTS==0.0.1+47c32ce
> Searching for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
> Reading https://pypi.org/simple/phonemizer/
> Couldn't find index page for 'phonemizer' (maybe misspelled?)
> Scanning index of all packages (this may take a while)
> Reading https://pypi.org/simple/
> No local packages or working download links found for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
> error: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master')
> I took the old syntax from the master branch, and it worked fine, specifically:
> 
>     install_requires=[
>         ...
>         "phonemizer"
>     ],
>     dependency_links=[
>         'http://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master#egg=phonemizer'
>     ],
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@reuben that also does not work on cluster
Hm. It works for me with pip 19.2.3 + setuptools 41.2.0
Maybe add a `pip install -U pip setuptools wheel` to your scripts?
The easiest way to fix this properly would be if phonemizer was published on PyPI :/
Looks like you need at least pip 18.1 for this to work: https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/5571

Maybe we can have both the old and the new version and it'll work for all versions of pip?

@JRMeyer @erogol does this work for you?

```diff
diff --git a/setup.py b/setup.py
index b824b10..d3e6ed8 100644
--- a/setup.py
+++ b/setup.py
@@ -83,4 +83,7 @@ setup(
         "soundfile",
         "phonemizer @ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master",
     ],
+    dependency_links = [
+        "http://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master#egg=phonemizer-1.0.1"
+    ],
 )
```

@reuben even updating pip does not change it for me

```
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Installed /data/rw/pit/src
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Processing dependencies for TTS==0.0.1+b1657d7
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Searching for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Reading https://pypi.org/simple/phonemizer/
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Couldn't find index page for 'phonemizer' (maybe misspelled?)
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Scanning index of all packages (this may take a while)
[2019-08-28 17:02:13] [worker 0] Reading https://pypi.org/simple/
[2019-08-28 17:02:35] [worker 0] No local packages or working download links found for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
[2019-08-28 17:02:35] [worker 0] error: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master')

```

I'll try adding the old lines

@reuben --- Your patch works for me:)

Without the patch, just like erogol, when I use the new `requirements.txt` install breaks even with newest `pip`:

```
josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ virtualenv -p python3.7 venv; source venv/bin/activate;
Running virtualenv with interpreter /usr/bin/python3.7
Using base prefix '/usr'
/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/virtualenv.py:1086: DeprecationWarning: the imp module is deprecated in favour of importlib; see the module's documentation for alternative uses
  import imp
New python executable in /home/josh/git/TTS/venv/bin/python3.7
Also creating executable in /home/josh/git/TTS/venv/bin/python
Installing setuptools, pkg_resources, pip, wheel...done.
(venv) josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ pip install -U pip
Requirement already up-to-date: pip in ./venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages (19.2.3)
(venv) josh@stealth:~/git/TTS$ python setup.py develop
running develop
-- Building version 0.0.1+47c32ce
running egg_info
writing TTS.egg-info/PKG-INFO
writing dependency_links to TTS.egg-info/dependency_links.txt
writing requirements to TTS.egg-info/requires.txt
writing top-level names to TTS.egg-info/top_level.txt
package init file './__init__.py' not found (or not a regular file)
reading manifest file 'TTS.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
writing manifest file 'TTS.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
running build_ext
Creating /home/josh/git/TTS/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/TTS.egg-link (link to .)
Adding TTS 0.0.1+47c32ce to easy-install.pth file

Installed /home/josh/git/TTS
Processing dependencies for TTS==0.0.1+47c32ce
Searching for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
Reading https://pypi.org/simple/phonemizer/
Couldn't find index page for 'phonemizer' (maybe misspelled?)
Scanning index of all packages (this may take a while)
Reading https://pypi.org/simple/
No local packages or working download links found for phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master
error: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('phonemizer@ https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer/tarball/master')
```

I just realized you were doing `python setup.py develop` rather than `pip install /path/to/checkout`. It turns out `setup.py develop` and `pip install --editable` don't respect the `package_dir` option we use to add an additional TTS parent package to our packages, so you get completely different behavior if you install with or without '-e' (or if you use `setup.py develop`).

I'm finally understanding what people say about Python packaging being awful.

So I guess this is the current status: if you just want to use TTS, `pip install` should work fine. If you want to develop TTS, then unfortunately `sys.path` manipulation is the way to go. Either that or we restructure the files in the repo to move all packages to a TTS subfolder. But that breaks all branches and would make rebases/uplifts a nightmare.
I proposed a hacky fix for `pip install -e` and `python setup.py develop` here: #269

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. You might also look our discourse page for further help. https://discourse.mozilla.org/c/tts
